{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3129362,"name":"","username":"somerandomuser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b2d939/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T00:04:38.220Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Our team has recently been having issues with 2023 FRC Driver Station. Communications keeps cutting out randomly. This prevents us from driving the robot smoothly. We didn’t have this issue with 2022 FRC driver station. There doesn’t seem to be any error message associated with this problem. Has anyone else experienced such an issue? If so, definitely let me know.

Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T00:04:48.283Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":250,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":1277.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423780,"topic_slug":"communication-crashing-on-2023-frc-driver-station","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52621,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/communication-crashing-on-2023-frc-driver-station/423780/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3129384,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T00:32:28.655Z","cooked":"

We’re going to need some more information first.

  1. How are you connected to the robot? USB? Ethernet? Wifi?
  2. If wifi, what port on the radio is your rio pluged into?
  3. If wifi or ethernet, is there a network switch in between, or are you directly connected to the rio?
  4. Does your driver station laptop have the windows firewall enabled? Vpn or antivirus software installed/enabled? Unused network adapters enabled?
  5. Does your rio have any i2c devices connected to the rio? If so, how (onboard vs mxp port)?
  6. What do the Rio LEDs do when the DS comms light goes red?

There may be more depending on the answers.

If you need help figuring out how to check any of these, please feel free to ask.

Also having these issues occasionally.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T14:54:49.229Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":18.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423780,"topic_slug":"communication-crashing-on-2023-frc-driver-station","display_username":"Weaver Goldman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Calvin and Hobbes connoisseur"},"post_url":"/t/communication-crashing-on-2023-frc-driver-station/423780/3","custom_user_title":"Calvin and Hobbes connoisseur","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3130238,"name":"L","username":"llthehackr","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/2acd7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T01:45:19.851Z","cooked":"

(Fellow team member to @somerandomuser here)

We are connected through Wifi, using a standard FRC radio. The radio is plugged into the Ethernet port on the rio. There is no switch between the laptop and the rio, it is a direct connection. There are not i2c devices connected to the robot directly. No other (wifi) network adapters are present on the laptop, the firewall is completely off, no antiviruses or vpns installed. Today, communications was completely fine, so I cannot provide any information on the Rio LEDs.

We did realize today that one of the times communications was especially spotty, there were 2 laptops, both with shuffleboard and driverstation connected to it at the same time. Could that be the possible cause of the issue? No information is sent to shuffleboard, however we did print to the console a lot.

Thanks

Having two laptops connected to the robot might be the issue. I am only a freshmen but our upperclassmen in programming only allow one person at a time to deploy and test code.

Only one driverstation application can be connected at a time. If a second is running on the same network, it should show a constant red comms light until the other one disconnects (application closed or PC disconnects from the network). I wouldn’t expect it to intermittently gain/lose comms
